content.question: The United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea sets the limit of the exclusive economic zone at 200 nautical miles from a countryâ€™s coastline. In cases where countries are less than 400 nautical miles apart at sea, which of the following explains how the exclusive economic zone boundary is determined for each country?

choices.label: Both countries will state their case to the United Nations during a hearing of the Security Council.
Both countries will follow the median-line principle.
Both countries will share all of the water area.
Neither country can claim the area as an exclusive economic zone because the area is considered international water.
Both countries will receive increased territorial sea claims up to 24 nautical miles but will have no exclusive economic zone.

content.answer: Both countries will follow the median-line principle.
